page.title: 07A CHILD IN HAM 60 YEARS AG0
page.content: { Ham}used to be a little village in the country. There were a few shops,{a {sweet shop, a grocer, a butcher}and{a {general store}that sold everything from butter to paraffin. The rest of Ham was just{farms}and{orchards.}The rent for a cottage in Ham Street was about{7/6d}(37.5p) per week. They had no electricity but they had{gas} downstairs. Each cottage had a{kitchen {range}and a{copper}in it. The{lavatory was half way down the garden. Going to {school}must have been very hard because even for not holding your pencil properly you were{caned}across the knuckles. On the 24th.May,{Empire {Day}each child was given a{bun}and an{ {orange}by Mr.Hill the baker. Pocket money was{2d}(0.5p) spent on{sweets} which were wrapped up in a{newspaper {cone.}
